title: 1964 Chevrolet Impala

description: For sale in our Milwaukee showroom is this X77 bodied 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28.  The Z/28 was introduced as the highest performer of the Camaro lineup.  With a 302 rated at 290 horsepower and an option of 4-speed manual transmissions, lots of racing, both legal and otherwise, has been done in these machines over the years.  This example started life as a Rallye Green, but has since been painted this beautiful coat of Dark Metallic Blue.  Unfortunately, as is not uncommon with these street legal racecars, the original Ã¢??DZÃ¢?Â coded engine was damaged and replaced with a 302 CID engine rebuilt to factory specifications.  The M21 4-speed is believed to be original to the vehicle, as well as the 3.73 12-bolt rear axle.The standard black buckets are in fantastic shape and show minimal wear.  The dash layout brings back a time of simplicity with large, easy to read gauges showing your current speed, the time, and engine speed.  The lenses are all clear, giving you an unobstructed view to the vitals of your engine.  The shifter sits at the perfect altitude to let you dominate the gears.  Whether just cruising along, enjoying the sights and sounds of your town, or barreling down the track, hunting for quicker times, this machine does it all.Options on this beautiful Ã¢??69 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28 include: AM/FM/Cassette, Power Brakes, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, Radial Tires with Raised White Letters, and Rallye WheelsThis vehicle is located in our Milwaukee showroom. You can view this 1969 Chevrolet Camaro in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.com. If you are interested in purchasing this vehicle or have more questions regarding it please call us at (262)-891-4253 or email us at Milwaukee@gatewayclassiccars.com.

title: 1970 Chevrolet Chevelle

description: For sale in our Atlanta showroom is a sultry 1970 Chevrolet Corvette convertible. This Laguane Gray beauty is quite a find. This '70 Corvette for sale is powered by a 350 cubic inch small block Chevy V8 engine. Built for performance and reliability, this Vette was a car that was no slouch on the streets, to say the least. With a humble rumble coming from dual exhaust, this is the classic late 60s sports car you've been dreaming about. A real classic in anyone's mind, this C3 Corvette for sale is ready for miles upon miles of fun! Backing the Chevy V8 is a 4-speed manual transmission. Easy shifting, this Corvette is a blast to drive, especially when adding in the 4-wheel disc brakes and power steering. The exterior is a sexy shade of Laguane Gray. The fine Metallic hugs every curve and sparkles when hit with sunlight. This exterior is subtle, with just enough "pop" to turn heads. With the top down, this Vette is the epitome of a cool cruising 70s muscle car! Add in the factory style rally wheels, and you have a vehicle that's a complete throwback! Sitting on the inside of the cab, you feel like you've been taken back in time to the late 70s. The Red interior is original style and looks absolutely delicious when matched with the Metallic Gray exterior. Sitting in this 1970 Chevy Corvette convertible for sale is like jumping into a cockpit. The shifter just begs to be grabbed. Options on this 1970 Chevrolet Corvette convertible for sale, include: AM/FM radio, manual convertible top, power steering, power windows, seat belts, and rally wheels wrapped in radial tires. This little C4 Corvette is a fun cruiser and is ready for its next adventure! For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833 or e-mail us at Atlanta@GatewayClassicCars.com.

description: 1965 Corvette Stingray Roadster
365HP
NOM SBC V8
4-Speed Close Ratio Transmission
Knock Off Wheel Covers with Spinner Centers
White Leather Interior
Literally Everything Restored and or New.

’65 Corvette firsts included standard four-wheel disc brakes, available sidepipes, and optional teak steering wheels — imagine a midyear Corvette and I’d be willing to bet the car you’re visualizing in your head has all three. Our subject car does, too. Consider that a bonus !

It has been driven precious few miles since the completion of its restoration in 2002, which included refinishing  in the original color combination of Rally Red with a White interior, updated from original vinyl to luxury leather.. Mechanical and cosmetic details include literally hundreds of new nuts, bolts and plastics updates and refinishing to a like new look.
This is the kind of car you buy and drive on Hot August Nights or to weekend shows, cosmetically beautiful and powerful,   Why?
Because you can!

description: This is is a very clean 1967 Corvette coupe, factory 4 speed car with a 350 4 bolt main engine currently in it.  This is an original 327 Marlboro Maroon car that has been well kept and is good looking and very good running as well.  AC works (Hurricane AC and heat system) and has been upgraded to new compressor and R134, Power disc brakes and Power steering.  Classic style modern radio system.      This car spent the majority of its life with the same family until several years ago when it traded hands and made its way to California.   The car is straight with nice gaps and nice original interior in very good shape.  The hood isa big block hood and the wheels are knockoffs in great shape.  The side pipes are new and the car is ready to drive and enjoy. Rebuilt Munice 4 speed.  Newer battery, New clutch.  Lots of receipts.       paint is overall nice on the car but there is a few flaws in the paint.  There is some small drips front lft and a blend area in the rear below the gas tank (see pics).  Newer red line tires with few miles on them.      Overall very nice car for the money, turn key, ready to go and enjoy for summer.  1967 Corvettes are amongst the hottest of them all; dont miss out on a fun car to drive and collect.  These cars will continue to rise in value.      Great lease rates and Financing also available on any of our inventory!   Buy Sell Trade Consignments Welcome!   Please email concierge@fusionluxurymotors.com or call 1-818-773-8181

title: 1967 Chevrolet Corvette

description: The 1970 Chevrolet Chevelle coupe was one of the baddest cars on the streets, and it's one of the most desired muscle cars today.  So finding one with right Super Sport look, and big block power, might just be the right way to become the king of the neighborhood without taking out another mortgage.

Giving a Chevelle a Super Sport makeover isn't a new fad, but when you have one of the most attractive muscle cars around, people tend to respect it. So when the time came for a restoration, they decided to go all-out and give this car a quality respray that would emulate one of Chevy's most potent machines.  You can tell it took careful work transforming what was once an Astro Blue coupe, into the mean machine you see today.  Modern red paint with a clearcoat shine is only for the bold.  It has a radiating presence the moment sunlight hits it, and the cherry hue highlights the exceptionally straight body.  Black SS stripes on a cowl induction hood are a big part of the appeal of the Super Sport model, as well as the blacked-out SS grille, and the correct badging.  Nice chrome bumpers, hood pins, polished stainless fender trim, and large 20-inch alloys with a sinister shine complete a package that looks ready for a weekend's worth of cruising.

Just like the exterior, the interior was given the right muscle car makeover.  Black vinyl is what we all love to see, especially when it matches the exterior stripes.  This is comfy for up to six people, so family and friends can cruise in style.  But this is truly a driver's car.  The whole panel, including the ultra wide speedometer, stereo, and heat/defrost sliders, are all geared towards you. If you didn't already get these hints about the enhanced power from this coupe's appearance, then the rumble that happens when you twist the key will certainly clue you in.

This car's big and mean attitude extents to under the hood, too.  The orange block of the 396 cubic-inch motor just looks like its radiating power as it fills the dark engine bay.  And it backs up this appearance with go-fast goodies like the Holley double-pumper four-barrel carburetor, Weiand performance intake, and long tube headers that feed the intimidating exhaust.  The big block moves this classic coupe with authority, so you'll be glad to also have features like the stout TH350 three-speed automatic transmission, power steering, power brakes, and modern performance tires.

You're looking at the sought-after year for Chevelles, complete with a standout colors and big block V8 power.  So this coupe is bold from its paint to its core, which makes it the perfect classic to grab all the right kind of attention.  Call now!!

description: GR Auto Gallery is pleased to offer a recently restored American icon: This stunning 1970 Chevrolet C10 4X4 Long Box Pickup. This truck features a 350 v8 mated to a column shift, automatic transmission.  The engine received an Edelbrock aluminum intake and carburetor.  The truck also has chrome valve covers and air cleaner.  The C10 also has a new alternator, power steering, and power brakes.  The truck is dressed in blue paint and looks great.  The chrome bumpers, badging and beauty rings are all in great shape.  The truck rides on 35x12.50 BFG Mud-Terrains mounted on 15 inch wheels.  The bed has a spray in bed liner and a diamond plate toolbox.  The cargo lamp light that lights up the bed works great.

Mechanically this truck is fantastic, the 350 runs very strong, the transmission is tight and shifts smoothly, the 4 wheel drive is ready to take on the toughest roads. Classic Chevy trucks are very popular as they are a symbol of ruggedness; toughness and the building of Americas back bone. A restored example as the one offered here are hard to find in this condition and a value given the price offered here.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com
title: 1970 Chevrolet C/K 10 Series
